703595f.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703595f.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and New York
Avenues, showing W. P. A. construction operations, near one of
the Kings County Hospital's many units.
March 10, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
703595f.folder: Clarkson Avenue & Albany Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703593f.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703593f.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and Sew York
Avenues. Shown are units of Eings County Hospital, one of
them under construction by W. P. A. workmen (left). The
landscaping, too, is being done by W. P. A. laborers.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
703593f.folder: Clarkson Avenue & Albany Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703597f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703597f-a.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and New York
Avenues, showing one of the buildings of Kings County Hospital
and a W. P. A. street improvement project.
June 6, 1936
Federal Art Project
Works Progress Administration
Photographic Division
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

703594f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703594f-a.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and New York
Avenues, showing a new building of Kings County Hospital, be-
ing erected by the Works Progress Administration.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City Wide Project
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

703592f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703592f-a.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and New York
Avenues, showing W. P. A. workmen working on one of the build-
ings of Eings County Hospital, as part of a large construction
project being conducted here by the federal agency.
June 6, 1936
Federal Art Project--W. P. A.

703600f-a.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and New York
Avenues, showing W. P. A. construction operations at Kings
County Hospital. Eew buildings were erected and general im-
provements wade by the federal ewergency relief agency.

703605f-a.text:
i3)
Clarkson Ave., north side, between Albany and Troy Aves., showing
the Kings County Lunatic Asylum, built in 1845, at a cost of t16,000.
March 1925.

703599f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703599f-a.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and Wew York
Avenues. Shown are W. P. A. workmen doing landscaping on the
grounds of Kings County Hospital.
January 11, 1937
Works Progress Administration
City wide Project

703598f-a.title: Brooklyn: Clarkson Avenue - Albany Avenue
703598f-a.text:
Clarkson Avenue, north side, between Albany and New York
Avenues. Shown are W. P. A. laborers conducting improvement
operations on the grounds of Kings County Hospital. In the
background is a new building which the W. P. A. erected.
June 6, 1936
Federal Art Project--W. P. A.
Photographic Division
